caption: Table 1: Regret for approximate (ε, δ)-DP algorithms. For readability, we omit logarithmic factors that depend on T and 1/δ.
description: This table compares the regret bounds achieved by prior work and the proposed work for differentially private online prediction from experts (DP-OPE) and differentially private online convex optimization (DP-OCO).  The regret is a measure of the algorithm's performance compared to the best possible outcome in hindsight.  The table shows that the new algorithms significantly improve upon the state-of-the-art, especially in the high-privacy regime where ε is small.
